result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C. Cooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony C. Cooks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony C. Cooks was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Deft IS eligible for the Earned Release Program & the Substance Abuse Program UPON serving (3) years of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).    Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with Javell Cooks or his residence unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is sentenced to 10 years in the WSP forthwith; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 186 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with Javell C. or his residence unless permitted by the court.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Diane Caspari.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 4/21/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA M Graveley.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Diane Caspari.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 3/3/16 at 1:00.  JT 3/7/16 at 8:30.  Defense motion to modify bond is denied.  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony C. Cooks appeared with Attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  ST called witness  KPD Ofc Bryan Koss; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Caspari. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial to Br 3.  DE files substitution of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 8. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:40 am.
